department.ch: 工業管理研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
This course will teach PP module under SAP S/4 HANA. In addition to this module, students will also have a Python coding assignment each week. Based on our past experience, coding work load is considered to be heavier than the PP module work load. 
Each student will be asked to implement two simple algorithms from the course textbook first – the first one is to implement a simple Genetic Algorithm and the second one is to implement a Branch-and-Bound Algorithm for a single machine scheduling problem. After these two simple assignments, two different sets of coding assignment will be given – one for scheduling coding track and another for data science coding track. For each coding assignment, this lab section will organize a discussion to assist students getting familiar with python and data structures for that assignment. Students will also be separated into two sub-sections for discussion – one for scheduling coding track and another one for data science coding track. These two sub-sections will be run in parallel. After this semester, students should know how to google possible coding answers over the Internet and have a limited coding experience which is required for the graduate study.

1Course introduction (SAP / PyCharm installation)
Coding project discussion 1: Project 1
2Business Process Overview
System-Wide Concepts
Coding project discussion 2: Project 1
 
3Manufacturing Planning and Execution
SAP fundamental use
Coding project discussion 3: Project 2
4Material Master Data
Coding project discussion 4: Project 2

goal.en:
This course will teach PP module under SAP S/4 HANA. In addition to this module, students will also have a Python coding assignment each week. Based on our past experience, coding work load is considered to be heavier than the PP module work load. 
Each student will be asked to implement two simple algorithms from the course textbook first – the first one is to implement a simple Genetic Algorithm and the second one is to implement a Branch-and-Bound Algorithm for a single machine scheduling problem. After these two simple assignments, two different sets of coding assignment will be given – one for scheduling coding track and another for data science coding track. For each coding assignment, this lab section will organize a discussion to assist students getting familiar with python and data structures for that assignment. Students will also be separated into two sub-sections for discussion – one for scheduling coding track and another one for data science coding track. These two sub-sections will be run in parallel. After this semester, students should know how to google possible coding answers over the Internet and have a limited coding experience which is required for the graduate study.
